required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surfactant Nebulization for the Early Aeration of the Preterm Lung
clinical_study.official_title: Surfactant Nebulization for the Early Aeration of the Preterm Lung: a Single Blinded, Parallel, Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Respiratory distress syndrome is the most common cause of respiratory failure in preterm infants. Treatment consists of respiratory support and exogenous surfactant administration. Commonly, surfactant is administered via an endotracheal tube during mechanical ventilation. However, mechanical ventilation is considered an important risk factor for developing bronchopulmonary dysplasia.
Surfactant nebulisation during noninvasive ventilation may offer an alternative method for surfactant administration and has been shown to be promising in terms of physiological as well as clinical changes. In preterm infants with respiratory distress syndrome, the effect of intratracheally administered surfactant on lung function during invasive ventilation has been studied extensively. However, the effect of early postnatal surfactant nebulization remains unclear.
Therefore, the investigators plan to conduct a randomized controlled trial in order to investigate the effect of surfactant nebulization immediately after birth on early postnatal lung volume and short-term respiratory stability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Between birth and 30 minutes of life.
primary_outcome.description: Change in EELI using electrical impedance tomography (arbitrary units per kilogram)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life and at 36 weeks postmenstrual age
secondary_outcome.description: EELI using electrical impedance tomography (arbitrary units per kilogram).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life and at 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
secondary_outcome.description: Regional ventilation distribution using electrical impedance tomography (arbitrary units per kilogram).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life and at 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
secondary_outcome.description: Tidal volumes using electrical impedance tomography (arbitrary units per kilogram).

secondary_outcome.measure: EIT: Association between EELI losses and SpO2/FiO2 ratio.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Association between the number of EELI losses >50% and the SpO2/FiO2 ratio.

secondary_outcome.measure: EIT: Association between EELI losses and need/level of respiratory support.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Association between the number of EELI losses >50% and the need/level of respiratory support.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the first 30 minutes after birth, as well as at 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of heart rate (beats per minute).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the first 30 minutes after birth, and at 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of SpO2 (%).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For the first 30 minutes after birth, and at 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of fraction of inspired oxygen.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: SpO2/FiO2 ratio.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the delivery room.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of events with body temperature <36.5 or >37.5Â°C.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 minutes of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of PIP in the control group (cmH2O).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 minutes of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of PEEP in the control group (cmH2O).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 minutes of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous recording of Vt in the control group (cmH2O).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: PEEP during noninvasive and invasive ventilation [mbar]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: PIP during noninvasive and invasive ventilation [mbar]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6, 12, and 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate during noninvasive and invasive ventilation [breaths per minute]

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical: Length and type of noninvasive respiratory support
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 minutes of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Total length of CPAP/NIPPV support assessed retrospectively using video recordings (min)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical: Total time on noninvasive and invasive respiratory support
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until 36 weeks postmenstrual age
secondary_outcome.description: Total time on invasive and noninvasive respiratory support (days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical: Frequency and duration of facemask repositioning
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 30 minutes after birth.
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency and duration of facemask repositioning assessed retrospectively using video recordings.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 24 and 72 hours of life, at 7 days of life. Until 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
secondary_outcome.description: Intubation rate (%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth until 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first intubation (days, minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical: Number of episodes of desaturation and bradycardia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 24 hours of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of episodes of desaturation (SpO2 <80%) and bradycardia (<80 beats per minute)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
secondary_outcome.description: BPD, maximum grade [number of cases]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 36 weeks postmenstrual age.

secondary_outcome.description: NEC, surgically treated [number of cases]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
secondary_outcome.description: Blood-culture positive sepsis [number of cases]

arm_group.description: The experimental group will receive a positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP, +/- noninvasive positive pressure ventilation) and nebulised surfactant via a customised vibrating membrane nebuliser. Nebulisation will commence with the first application of a PEEP and will continue for a maximum of 30 minutes.
The control group will receive standard care (PEEP, +/- noninvasive positive pressure ventilation, without surfactant nebulisation).

intervention.description: 200 mg/kg body weight nebulised surfactant (Poractant alfa, Chiesi Farmaceutici SpA, Parma, Italy) via a customised vibrating membrane nebuliser (eFlow neonatal nebuliser system, PARI Pharma, Starnberg).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- inborn
- gestational age at birth from 26 0/7 to 31 6/7 weeks
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe congenital malformation adversely affecting surfactant nebulisation or life expectancy
- a priori palliative care
- genetically defined syndrome

facility.name: Department of Neonatology, University Hospital Zurich

reference.citation: Minocchieri S, Berry CA, Pillow JJ; CureNeb Study Team. Nebulised surfactant to reduce severity of respiratory distress: a blinded, parallel, randomised controlled trial. Arch Dis Child Fetal Neonatal Ed. 2019 May;104(3):F313-F319. doi: 10.1136/archdischild-2018-315051. Epub 2018 Jul 26. Erratum in: Arch Dis Child Fetal Neonatal Ed. 2020 Mar;105(2):e1.
